original: Bendz, Gunnar Martin Edvard, president, Jönköping, f. 30/10/83 i Karjs-hamn av lärov :kollegan, fil. dr Anders B. o. Elin Grönvall. G. 10 m. Kerstin Bendz. Barn: Astrid f. 11, g. m. sekr. i Jönköp. 1. hush :s’ällsk., ryttmäst. Helge Rösiö, Margareta 12, hemgårdsförest., Per 14, med. lic., Eb- ba 17, g. m. e. o. byråsekr. C. E. Ullman. — Mog:ex. 02, jur. fil. ex. 03, jur. utr. kand. 06, allt i Upps. E. o. not. i Svea hovr. 06, tingstjg. i Falu o. Västerbergslags doms. 08-09, tf. fiskal i Svea hovr. ■ 12, e. o. assessor 13, assessor 15, tf. rev:sekr. 15, hovr:-råd 20, rev:sekr. 23, suppl. f. MO 24, MO 26, presid. i Göta hovr. sed. 30. Uppdr. i fin:dep. samt statens ind:-o. hand:komm. f. författn :frågOT m. m. 17-19, sakk. i just:dep. f. lagstiftn. ang. upphäv, av patronatsrätt 19-20, led. av o. sekr. i gruvlagstiftn :sakk. 20-23, led. av patronatsrättsnd 21-25, Uppdr. i just:dep. ang. lag om panträtt i spannmål 24 o. 25, led. av bank-lagskomm. 24-27, ordf. i 36 års dom-sagokomm. o. i 43 års domarutredn., ordf. i Jönköp. jur. fören., v. ordf. i fören. Sv:es hovr:domare, led. av styr. f. Sv:es domarförb. Skr.: Uti. gruvlagstiftn. (i komm:betänk. 24), Om hovrätterna fr. deras uppkomst t. 1734 års- lag (i Festskr. ägnad 1734 års lag 34), Göta hovr. genom seklerna (35), Skånska bondeupploppen 1811 inför Göta hovr. (41), art. i tidn. o. tidskr. KmstkNO, RVO.
translated: Bendz, Gunnar Martin Edvard, President of Jönköping, born on October 30th, 1883 in Karlskrona, to school-counselor, PhD Anders B. and Elin Grönvall. Married to Kerstin Bendz on 10th m. Children: Astrid (b. 1911), married to secretary in Jönköping, 1st marriage to cavalry captain Helge Rösiö; Margareta (b. 1912), house-farm supervisor; Per (b. 1914), medical PhD; Ebba (b. 1917), married to a bureau secretary C.E. Ullman. Graduated from Uppsala University with a Master’s in Law in 1902, a Bachelor’s in Philosophy in 1903, and a Law candidate in 1906. Became a court clerk in the Svea Court of Appeal and a district court judge in Falun and Västerbergslagen from 1906-1909, Acting Associate Judge in the Svea Court of Appeal in 1912, Associate Judge in 1913, Acting Revenue Secretary in 1915, Appellate Judge in 1920, Revenue Secretary in 1923, alternate member of the Supreme Court in 1924, and member of the Supreme Court in 1926, President of the Göta Court of Appeal from 1930. Held various roles in the Ministry of Finance and State Law Committee for Constitution and more from 1917-1919. Served as an adviser in the Ministry of Justice for legislating the abolition of patronage rights from 1919-1920, a member of a mining legislation subcommittee from 1920-1923, a member of the Patronage Rights Committee from 1921-1925, Adviser in the Ministry of Justice for the mortgage law on wheat, 1924 and 1925, Chairman of the Banking Law Committee from 1924-1927, Chairman of 36 years Court Sagokomm and 43 years Court Investigation, Chairman of the Jönköping Law Association, Vice-Chairman of the Swedish Judge Association Association, member of the board of the Swedish Judges Association. Wrote on Mining legislation (in the 1924 committee recommendation), history of the appellate courts before the 1734 navigation act (in the Festskrift devoted to the 1734 navigation act in 1934), the Göta Court of Appeal throughout the centuries (1935), and peasant uprisings in Skåne in 1811 before the Göta Court of Appeal (1941). Knight of the Royal Order of the Polar Star and the Royal Order of Vasa.
